data.prompt_text: From a static, top-down perspective, a hand executes a sequence of actions. First, a pen and an eraser are moved out of the frame, revealing the full surface of a closed laptop. The laptop is then lifted and moved out of the frame, revealing a book underneath. This book is subsequently lifted and moved out of the frame, uncovering a final blue textbook. To conclude the sequence, this final textbook is also slid out of the frame, leaving the surface empty. This demonstrates a nested hierarchy of occlusion and revelation.
data.strict_prompt: From a static, top-down perspective, a hand executes a sequence of actions. First, a pen and an eraser are moved out of the frame, revealing the full surface of a closed laptop. The laptop is then lifted and moved out of the frame, revealing a book underneath. This book is subsequently lifted and moved out of the frame, uncovering a final blue textbook. To conclude the sequence, this final textbook is also slid out of the frame, leaving the surface empty. This demonstrates a nested hierarchy of occlusion and revelation.
data.relax_prompt: A hand removes every object from the frame, one by one. Static camera, no pan, no zoom.

data.prompt_text: A small basketball is dropped into a black crate that has a pattern of holes on its sides. The stand starts to spin. Static camera, no pan, no zoom.
data.strict_prompt: From a static, front-facing perspective, a small basketball falls into a black plastic crate whose sides are a lattice structure. The event provides a clear demonstration of partial occlusion. As the ball descends into the crate, its continuous form is visually fragmented by the grid pattern of the crate's walls. Portions of the orange ball remain visible through the diamond-shaped openings, while other parts are simultaneously concealed by the solid black plastic, creating a dynamic interplay of visible and hidden surfaces until the ball comes to rest.
data.relax_prompt: A small basketball is dropped into a black crate that has a pattern of holes on its sides. The stand starts to spin. Static camera, no pan, no zoom.

data.prompt_text: A pink sphere rolls down. The camera moves to right faster than the ball until the ball disappears off the screen, then it stops and starts moving backward. Static camera, no pan, no zoom.
data.strict_prompt: In a surreal, 3D animated scene, a complex sequence of coordinated motion occurs. A pink sphere rolls down a slope to the right while the camera simultaneously executes a dolly shot in the same direction, but at a higher velocity. This differential speed causes the sphere to exit the frame on the left. As the camera's rightward trajectory continues, it reveals more of the desert landscape, including several palm trees. The camera then halts and reverses its motion, beginning a new dolly shot back to the left. As it tracks leftward, the pink sphere, having continued its own trajectory, re-enters the frame.
data.relax_prompt: A pink sphere rolls down. The camera moves to right faster than the ball until the ball disappears off the screen, then it stops and starts moving backward. Static camera, no pan, no zoom.

The experiment clearly demonstrates the principles of buoyancy and density, ending with a shot of the two oranges in their final floating and sunken follow.

data.prompt_text: Two bouncy balls are sitting together on a table. A third ball rolls in and hits the first one. Static camera, no pan, no zoom, no dolly.
data.strict_prompt: From a static, slightly elevated perspective, two small, spherical bouncy balls rest in a touching line on a wooden table. A third, similar ball is launched from the left and collides squarely with the first ball of the stationary pair. In a clear demonstration of the conservation of momentum and energy, the impacting ball comes to a near-complete stop. The middle ball remains almost stationary, acting as a medium to transfer the momentum, which propels the final ball away with a velocity similar to the initial impact.

data.prompt_text: A spinning black thing with a little stick on it turns and hits the first block on the right. Static camera, no pan, no zoom, no dolly.
data.strict_prompt: From a static, slightly elevated perspective, a row of six colorful rectangular blocks stands on end. To their right, a black cylindrical device with a wooden stick attached to its top surface begins to rotate. The stick sweeps around and strikes the rightmost (purple) block, initiating a chain reaction. As each block falls, its potential energy is converted into kinetic energy, creating a self-propagating wave of toppling that travels from right to left, leaving all the blocks lying flat in a cascade.
data.relax_prompt: A spinning black thing with a little stick on it turns and hits the first block on the right. Static camera, no pan, no zoom, no dolly.

data.prompt_text: A static, fixed-camera shot with even, neutral lighting captures a scene on a light-colored wooden tabletop against a solid yellow background. On the right side of the frame, a brown cardboard ramp is propped up at an angle by a blue block, and a stationary black cylindrical object rests on the far left. A yellow tennis ball is launched from the left side of the frame, rolling across the table and up the ramp. Its upward motion slows due to gravity until it momentarily stops at its highest point, then it reverses direction and rolls back down the ramp. It travels back across the table toward the left, reaches the edge, and falls off the table, dropping out of view. The physics should be realistic, accurately depicting the conversion of kinetic and potential energy, deceleration on an incline, rolling friction, and the final projectile motion as it falls off the edge. Do not include any hands, text overlays, or sound.

data.prompt_text: Placing a blue block off-center on a stable two-block tower. Static camera, no pan, no zoom.
data.strict_prompt: From a static, front-facing perspective, a stable T-shaped structure made of a red and a yellow block rests on a table. A clamp slowly lowers a blue block to place it vertically on the yellow block. However, it is placed in an off-center position. This addition shifts the system's combined center of mass outside the narrow base of support, creating an unbalanced torque. The structure immediately enters an unstable equilibrium and topples under gravity, scattering the blocks across the table.
data.relax_prompt: Placing a blue block off-center on a stable two-block tower. Static camera, no pan, no zoom.

data.prompt_text: A green circle of light is projected to partially overlap a red circle of light. Static camera, no pan, no zoom, no dolly.
data.strict_prompt: From a static, close-up perspective in a laboratory setting, a circle of red light is projected onto a white screen by an optical light source. A green light is then activated from the same source, its projected circle partially overlapping the red one. A hand is shown gradually increasing the intensity of the green light. This event demonstrates the principle of additive color mixing: as the intensity of the green light increases, the area of superposition where the red and green wavelengths combine is perceived as a progressively brighter and more saturated shade of yellow.
data.relax_prompt: A green circle of light is projected to partially overlap a red circle of light. Static camera, no pan, no zoom, no dolly.

data.prompt_text: A tennis ball with a smiley face sits on a little rotating stand. The stand starts to spin. Static camera, no pan, no zoom.
data.strict_prompt: From a static, eye-level perspective, a tennis ball with a smiley face rests on a motorized turntable on a wooden table, next to a large vertical plane mirror. The turntable begins to rotate at a constant angular velocity, causing the tennis ball to spin. As the real ball rotates, its virtual image in the mirror rotates in perfect synchrony. This provides a clear demonstration of uniform circular motion and the laws of plane mirror reflection, showing the smiley face disappearing and reappearing on both the object and its image simultaneously.
data.relax_prompt: A tennis ball with a smiley face sits on a little rotating stand. The stand starts to spin. Static camera, no pan, no zoom.

data.prompt_text: A glass of water is slowly slid in front of a piece of paper with a pattern of black and white wavy lines going up and down. Static camera, no pan, no zoom.
data.strict_prompt: From a static, front-facing perspective, a cylindrical glass of water is moved in front of a background pattern of vertical wavy lines. The water-filled glass functions as a thick cylindrical lens, causing the light from the pattern to refract as it passes through. This refraction results in a significant optical distortion: the image of the pattern seen through the glass is both magnified and inverted along the horizontal axis. The effect visually transforms the vertical wavy lines into a pattern of serpentine curves.
data.relax_prompt: A glass of water is slowly slid in front of a piece of paper with a pattern of black and white wavy lines going up and down. Static camera, no pan, no zoom.
